page.title: 19TOURISM, MUSEUM, CRAFTS
page.content: There are 3 small caravan sites in the area. Pennine Lodge provides overnight accommodation, evening meals, morning coffee and afternoon tea. 'Field Fare' at Wearhead and 'Rancho del Rio' at Ireshopeburn provide meals, both are licensed and the latter has a small bar. The Museum at High House was op- ened by David Bellamy in May 1985 and had 3773 visitors in its first season. The Weardale Room is a replica of a 19th century cottage kitchen, the Wesley Room deals with the history of religion in the Dale and upstairs are displays of local geology, natural history, history, farming, railways, Burnhope Reservoir and industries. In Ireshopeburn are a potter who sells much of his characteristic brown and green pottery wholesale and 2 weavers producing tapestries and woven goods and selling wool and water colours.
